page.title: 16HOUSING IN LEEK (CONT'D)
page.content: ALSO ON THE OUTSKIRTS OF THE TOWN THERE ARE TWO LARGE COUNCIL HOUSE ESTATES. THESE ESTATES WERE BUILT BY THE TOWN COUNCIL AND THEN LEASED OUT AT VERY LOW RENTS TO LEEK RESIDENTS. BY DOING THIS THE COUNCIL WERE ABLE TO PULL DOWN ALL THE VERY OLD HOUSES WHICH WERE UNFIT TO LIVE IN. TODAY, IF YOU LIVE ON ONE OF THE COUNCIL ESTATES YOU MAY BUY THE HOUSE YOU LIVE IN IF YOU WANT TO. IN THE AREA AROUND LEEK THERE ARE MANY STONE COTTAGES AND FARMHOUSES WHICH ARE STILL IN USE EVEN THOUGH MANY OF THEM ARE OVER TWO HUNDRED YEARS OLD. AT THE TOP OF THE MARKET SQUARE THERE IS A ROW OF STONE COTTAGES WHERE IT IS REPUTED BONNIE PRINCE CHARLES SLEPT ONE NIGHT WHEN HE WAS ON HIS MARCH TO DERBY. LEEK HAS THE BENEFIT OF THE NEW HOUSING ESTATES WHILE STILL RETAINING MUCH OF THE ORIGINAL SHAPE OF THE TOWN.
